m3YVnvOv6PZv9-jgPmxTsg.text: Our friends recommended us this restaurant located in the Tanglin Mall, and it's delicious. One of the better QUALITY thai dining in Sing, which is hard to find. I dare to say that it was similar in taste and quality to some of the dishes at the actual Blue Elephant royal thai cuisine we tried in Bangkok, Thailand. But this is Singapore, and any of the quality dishes come with a hefty price tag, even if it's thai food. So expect to spend around $100 for a party of two, without any drinks. While we love other thai dishes, we just stuck with our typical favorite:Shrimp Pad thaiChicken Pad SiewPineapple Fried RiceMango Sticky Riceseems like a lot to share between the two, but the portions are tiny and we were scraping the plates for more. Mango sticky rice dessert was just okay- we still haven't found one that parallels the taste we fell in love with in Thailand.  overall, perfect place for a regular date night or couple dates!

DROT3VFeCGLFDq6NAr44LQ.text: The food is very good. There are some unusual dishes rarely found in Thai restaurants overseas, and execution is quite masterful. Service is courteous and competent. What makes this not a top-end restaurant as it aims to be and as reflected in its pricing is the very dated décor, more comfortable than smart.

photos.caption: Photo of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine - Singapore, Singapore

AR9MkgvvKnCOwnccoG_bJg.text: Patara is located on upper level of Tanglin mall,  it is considered upscale Thai but that has to do a lot with the decor and ambience.  The food was good but not out of this world good. Thai green curry, soft shell crabs with mango, spring rolls and Tom yum soup were on the table for me.  Enjoyed it all.

RpzKUqRdVgD4nHRS4qZGRw.text: Ate here recently with coworkers and the appetizers and food were very good. It is conveniently located in the Tanglin Mall. The service was fine. Enjoyed the food much better than the food at Jim Thompson which is a highly rated Thai restaurant in Singapore. It was better food and a better value.

2xH777TdcNRs3QQDPR246Q.text: One of my favorite places to have Thai Cuisine while staying in Singapore.  My favorite Tom Yum Goon soup among many other such as the spicy green curry and pineapple rice.  We were given a taste of some durian flavored dessert.  It was the first time I ever tried durian and it was interesting let's just say I will not try again. . I highly recommend this restaurant located in the Tanglin Shopping Center on Orchard Rd, walking distance from the Hilton & most hotels there On Orchard.

photos.caption: Photo of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine - Singapore, Singapore. Excellent Service
Photo of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine - Singapore, Singapore. Fabulous Thai food

iRVmD0Po0MU18cIITD67sw.text: The set meals are pricey but give you a chance to sample several little bits of multiple chef's recommended dishes. The Green curry with beef was spicy and went well with the fragrant jasmine rice. I also loved the creamy coconut chicken and mushroom soup. The Thai tea is a must have - so pretty you can't stop staring at the glass. For dessert give the coconut sticky rice a skip and have the mango cheesecake instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine - Singapore, Singapore. Jasmine rice with fried fish and mixed seafood with Thai herbs
Photo of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine - Singapore, Singapore. Green curry beef
Photo of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine - Singapore, Singapore. Thai tea

k93e4dbrHlBQ6oB6-zFKzw.text: Made 2 visits this month hoping for some good Thai food but since they came under the management of CreativeEats, the standard has really dropped. Their baked seafood glass noodles was too salty to eat and only had prawns. Pineapple rice did not even come in a pineapple and was a tad too sweet ( maybe in my opinion).  We also ordered the Morning Glory at S$19 and that came out very badly stir-fried and too small a portion. Also was very, very salty. The dessert platter was also disappointing with 2 pieces of dragonfruit, some pieces of melon and 2 pieces of Thai rice cakes. Thai fish cakes also tastes like it was from a frozen packet.We knew not to order the Tom Yum Soup which was at best mediocre. Staff were generally friendly, which was the saving grace but service time was too long. Our simple dinner for 2 took 2.5 hours from start to finish. Good quality and experience not worth the prices. Probably my last visit here.

ChmBMgeFd0RCODEjhiSL-g.text: This is a review of a dinner date at Patara Fine Thai Cuisine.It is a beautiful room with numerous ornate appointments.  This is a true Thai fine dining setting.tinyurl.com/bb7lvqstinyurl.com/b3qaxmvThe service was extremely good.  Throughout the meal, they were very attentive and helpful.  The meal proceeded at a nice unrushed pace.The food ranged from good to very good.Goong Thod Saweay (A combination of deep fried prawn in crispy rice vermicelli, chicken and vegetable spring rolls and golden pouches) - Each of these were good. But the golden pouches are the ones that stood out.  Wonderful little pouches hiding away a small succulent prawn.tinyurl.com/bb5xe5pHoy Shell (Seared sea scallops on half shell with chili lime dressing) - These were very perfectly prepared scallops with a touch of spice and citrus.  It was also a beautifully presented dish.tinyurl.com/a8rhvbvTom Yum Goong/Talay (Authentic hot spicy and sour prawns soup with Thai herbs, mushrooms, and sliced of young coconut meat) - This was a good Tom Yum.  My date requested it be mild.  I did not object.  So, it wasn't as super spicy as some versions of this soup.  The ingredients all came together very well.  I particularly enjoyed the mushrooms.  The prawns could have been a touch more tender. But, this is often the case with Tom Yum.  They keep cooking in the soup.  I had hoped it would be served in the traditional way. However, instead, we were simply each brought a bowl.tinyurl.com/bgqfce9See Krong Kae Yang (Pan-seared lemongrass marinated rack of lamb served with papaya salad and crisp sweet rice rolls) - This was a lamb lovers lamb.  It had a strong potent flavour.  The meat was tender.  This was another wonderfully presented dish.  The rice rolls were quite a refreshing balance to the strong flavour of the lamb.tinyurl.com/b5c2pb5Gang Daeng Gai (Thai chicken red curry with coconut heart and baby eggplants) - This was a very good curry.  The chicken was tender.  There was lots of depth of flavour. Every once in awhile, I would run into a pepper.  The heat went so well with the sweetness of the curry.  It was my favourite dish of the evening.tinyurl.com/beym4nsKhao Phad Poo (Fried rice with crabmeat and spring onions) - My date selected their fried rice with crabmeat.  it was pretty good.  It melded well with the other dishes.Thai Coconut - She enjoyed it so much that she had two of them.  As for me, I had 7-Up.tinyurl.com/a2mxgg5Receipt (Dinner for 2) - $204.80tinyurl.com/agxsz9mWith Thai restaurants, there is often an expectation with price.  It is often viewed as a lower priced meal.  However, most Thai restaurants do not provide an experience that works well for a date or special evening.  They tend to be hurried meals with little service.  The food is often amazing but the meal is over in 30 minutes.  The food at Patara is good and, at times, very good.  But it is not better than many hole in the wall Thai restaurants.  The presentation is a step up.  In service and ambiance, Patara delivers beyond most of these and creates a dining experience.  I feel Patara delivers an experience worthy of the premium.Overall - This was a nice evening meal.  The ambiance and service live up to the expectations of fine dining.  The food was consistently well prepared and beautifully presented.

Photo of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine - Singapore, Singapore. Hoy Shell (Seared Scallops) - Patara Fine Cuisine - Singapore
Photo of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine - Singapore, Singapore. Receipt - Patara Fine Cuisine - Singapore

fTG3DKhRvwO7NJwrOjg1NQ.text: fine cuisine but not so fine service. No service to speak of - just left menus on our table , had to alert them to say we were ready to order . After we had finished , they cleared the plates but did not wipe down the table . We were left to chat .... No one came to asked if we might be interested in having some desserts etc ... Even when we asked for the bill it didn't occur to server to ask if we wanted coffee . Overall quite pathetic standard of service ... But then again this is so typical of most local establishments . In the end I asked to see the Manager ... Who looked like she just left school !! I said to minus the 10% service charge from the bill which she obliged. As part of the "service recovery ", we were offers two $50 vouchers ( each for a min $120 spend on next visit ). Won't be back in a hurry ....

XcNvlG6fNKdGbNovvfMXgg.text: A-OK Thai foodPatara was probably one of the first Thai restaurants I visited in Singapore, and for that, I have pretty fond memories of it. The other outlet at City Hall has closed, so this is the only one left at this time.The setting is pretty elegant, in tasteful vibrant gold and dark wood, and the dishes come in gorgeous intricate plates. Expect all the staples that you would normally enjoy, including spicy tom yum soup (be sure to make your chilli tolerance known), and mango sticky rice. The best dishes are probably the wonderful olive fried rice, with bits of kaffir lime leaves in it, grilled jumbo prawns with lemongrass sauce, and roast duck curry - always a treat with hot fragrant rice. The service staff seem genuinely pleasant, a good indication of the quality of the Creative Eateries group (which this restaurant belongs to). Their sister restaurant is the more casual Bangkok Jam chain of diners.

pMjb3Zzq54rejK1MtOXxdQ.text: This used to be my favorite place for Thai food in Singapore, but after having been disappointed with their service in more than one recent occasion, I can no longer recommend this place to anyone anymore.

WD-xHeQ3T0qXquPLPLqLQQ.text: Tucked away innocuously in the predominantly ex-pat Tanglin mall, Patara's charms may not be evident to those who think that the best food is found only in the high rent downtown district.  As is the case with most higher end Singaporean food establishments, the service is friendly and helpful.  The olive fried rice is superb and the spices and curries are complex in their heat and flavours.  We had the prawns as well as the eggplant dishes, all superb.  Do not miss the mango and warm sticky rice.  It's not cheap though, so be warned. Turns out Patara has branches all over the world, but the one in Singapore is well worth the visit.

OjhbzwNTqxPvwhVw5R95KA.text: Excellent Patara quality that one comes to expect. Whilst the location and interior cannot compare to the London restaurants the food is excellent. In particular the Spicy Tuna Tartar. Strongly recommend it.

YBYbnNyM8ED4eaZhEky3Ag.text: They've got a good mango salad with soft shell crab, one of their signature dishes. However the other 2 other signature dishes we ordered were rather disappointing and certainly weren't worth the high prices. Water also comes at premium as they serve you glass bottled Evian water.

e6_CHnJwzZsc_YPZpNQ6Tw.text: my favorite thai restaurant in singapore.pricey, but the food is excellent.the prawn cakes are amazing, so is the tom yum soup, and the mee krob, and the pad thai, and the jumbo prawn.for dessert, the sticky rice with durian and vanilla ice cream is a must have, if you love durian. :)don't bother with the red ruby. it's fancy and pretty, but it's not worth the price tag. (ps. i just looked at their menu online...they don't list the durian dessert anymore. oh no.)
